comments.body:
Please ask upstream to add a MANIFEST.in with the license file included and make note of the issue/PR here with something like the following
```
# LICENSE.md is not included in upstream. Issue/PR raising this in upstream: link-to-issue-or-pr
# license_file: LICENSE.md
```

Sample Issue text for upstream:

The ISC license requires that the full text of the license be shipped with the project. Please add the following to MANIFEST.in. If you don't have MANIFEST.in, this is all it will contain.
```
include LICENSE.md
```

I am the upstream maintainer for this package as well.  Is this a pre-requisite for shipping the conda-forge package?  Would that require a new package version?  Or can I add the manifest at a later date?  This has never been an issue with other conda-forge packages I've built.

The preference is to include a license_file in the conda package that gets built. In lieu of having the license file available when the conda package is built the request is usually   

(1) add a MANIFEST.in to the python package upstream and note that this was done so that when the conda package is built for that version, we can include the license with the conda package or  

(2) include the license in the recipe directory [like this](https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/pull/2689/commits/10c83cbb29211dedcab4269ae16a1e34543e3fdd#diff-9e023f20b425c0bdb974c3812be0b592R31).  

FWICT this is more of a suggestion than a **YOU MUST DO THIS** :smile:. Up to you on this. If you'd prefer to do neither of those things, then :+1: from me
Okay, thanks!  I'll make the issue and roll it into the next minor revision.
Happy to merge as-is, unless you want to update the LICENSE stuff. You can also iterate on this in the feedstock once it is created
Thanks for the CR.  I'll handle it in the feedstock, if it's all the same to you. :grin:
